page.title: 01General- Introduction to Aby
page.content: The area is comprised of scattered farms & small villages, nestling at the foot of the chalk wolds. It is sparsely populated but rich in flora & fauna.{Spring waters}feed a fast-flowing well stocked trout river. Woodlands consist of coniferous & deciduous trees, with many newly planted along the winding country lanes. A dis-used railway line is rich in re-established wild life. The land is well drained, ditches contain some wild flowers. At{Belleau}an ancient {dovecot}is sited below a 13th Century church. The population is friendly, self-reliant, hardworking & caring. {Claythorpe water mill}is now used as a restaurant & private house. An attached smokery is supplied by the local trout farm.
